intro: Pentacalia libertatis, commonly known as the Liberty's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in coastal or woodland habitats. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
